answerText: The Decameron [10] This last person to tell a story describes the patient Griselda, who is stripped of her finery and must yield to a new bride. He tells a story about a woman who thinks a penis is a demon, and must put it into her vagina to contain it.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Brown University and Notre Dame | 20 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Pampinea tells the first story in this work, while the second is narrated by Fiammetta. For 10 points each:  [10] Seven women and three men who escaped to the countryside from the raging plague in Florence tell stories to pass the time in this book, a work by Giovanni Boccaccio.
